verses.verse: Now Naaman,<WH5283> captain<WH8269> of the army<WH6635> of the king<WH4428> of Aram,<WH758> was a great<WH1419> man<WH376> with his master,<WH113> and highly respected,<WH5375> <WH6440> because<WH3588> by him the Lord<WH3068> had given<WH5414> victory<WH8668> to Aram.<WH758> The man<WH376> was also a valiant<WH2428> warrior,<WH1368> [but he was] a leper.<WH6879>

Now the Arameans<WH758> had gone<WH3318> out in bands,<WH1416> and had taken<WH7617> captive<WH7628> a little<WH6996> girl<WH5291> from the land<WH776> of Israel;<WH3478> and she waited<WH1961> <WH6440> on Naaman's wife.<WH802>

And she said<WH559> to her mistress,<WH1404> "I wish<WH305> that my master<WH113> were with the prophet<WH5030> who<WH834> is in Samaria!<WH8111> Then<WH227> he would cure<WH622> him of his leprosy.<WH6883>"
And Naaman went<WH935> in and told<WH5046> his master,<WH113> saying,<WH559> "Thus<WH2088> and thus<WH2088> spoke<WH1696> the girl<WH5291> who<WH834> is from the land<WH776> of Israel.<WH3478>"

Then the king<WH4428> of Aram<WH758> said,<WH559> "Go<WH1980> now,<WH935> and I will send<WH7971> a letter<WH5612> to the king<WH4428> of Israel.<WH3478>" And he departed<WH1980> and took<WH3947> with him ten<WH6235> talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> and six<WH8337> thousand<WH505> [shekels] of gold<WH2091> and ten<WH6235> changes<WH2487> of clothes.<WH899>

And he brought<WH935> the letter<WH5612> to the king<WH4428> of Israel,<WH3478> saying,<WH559> "And now<WH6258> as this<WH2088> letter<WH5612> comes<WH935> to you, behold,<WH2009> I have sent<WH7971> Naaman<WH5283> my servant<WH5650> to you, that you may cure<WH622> him of his leprosy.<WH6883>"

And it came<WH1961> about when the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> read<WH7121> the letter,<WH5612> that he tore<WH7167> his clothes<WH899> and said,<WH559> "Am I God,<WH430> to kill<WH4191> and to make<WH2421> alive,<WH2421> that this<WH2088> man is sending<WH7971> [word] to me to cure<WH622> a man<WH376> of his leprosy<WH6883>? But consider<WH3045> now,<WH4994> and see<WH7200> how<WH3588> he is seeking<WH579> a quarrel<WH579> against me."

And it happened<WH1961> when Elisha<WH477> the man<WH376> of God<WH430> heard<WH8085> that the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> had torn<WH7167> his clothes,<WH899> that he sent<WH7971> [word] to the king,<WH4428> saying,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> have you torn<WH7167> your clothes<WH899>? Now<WH4994> let him come<WH935> to me, and he shall know<WH3045> that there<WH3426> is a prophet<WH5030> in Israel.<WH3478>"
So Naaman<WH5283> came<WH935> with his horses<WH5483> and his chariots,<WH7393> and stood<WH5975> at the doorway<WH6607> of the house<WH1004> of Elisha.<WH477>

And Elisha<WH477> sent<WH7971> a messenger<WH4397> to him, saying,<WH559> "Go<WH1980> and wash<WH7364> in the Jordan<WH3383> seven<WH7651> times,<WH6471> and your flesh<WH1320> shall be restored<WH7725> to you and [you shall] be clean.<WH2891>"

But Naaman<WH5283> was furious<WH7107> and went<WH1980> away and said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> I thought,<WH559> 'He will surely<WH3318> come<WH3318> out to me, and stand<WH5975> and call<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068> his God,<WH430> and wave<WH5130> his hand<WH3027> over<WH413> the place,<WH4725> and cure<WH622> the leper.<WH6879>'

"Are not Abanah<WH71> and Pharpar,<WH6554> the rivers<WH5104> of Damascus,<WH1834> better<WH2896> than<WH4480> all<WH3605> the waters<WH4325> of Israel<WH3478>? Could I not wash<WH7364> in them and be clean<WH2891>?" So he turned<WH6437> and went<WH1980> away in a rage.<WH2534>

Then his servants<WH5650> came<WH5066> near<WH5066> and spoke<WH1696> to him and said,<WH559> "My father, had the prophet<WH1> told<WH5030> you [to do some] great<WH1696> thing,<WH1419> would you not have done<WH1697> [it]? How<WH6213> much<WH637> <WH637> more<WH3588> <WH637> [then,] when<WH3588> he says<WH3588> to you, 'Wash,<WH559> and be clean<WH7364>'?"

So he went<WH3381> down<WH3381> and dipped<WH2881> [himself] seven<WH7651> times<WH6471> in the Jordan,<WH3383> according to the word<WH1697> of the man<WH376> of God;<WH430> and his flesh<WH1320> was restored<WH7725> like the flesh<WH1320> of a little<WH9512> child,<WH5288> and he was clean.<WH2891>

When he returned<WH7725> to the man<WH376> of God<WH430> with all<WH3605> his company,<WH4264> and came<WH935> and stood<WH5975> before<WH6440> him, he said,<WH559> "Behold<WH2009> now,<WH4994> I know<WH3045> that there<WH369> is no<WH369> God<WH430> in all<WH3605> the earth,<WH776> but in Israel;<WH3478> so please<WH4994> take<WH3947> a present<WH1293> from your servant<WH5650> now.<WH6258>"

But he said,<WH559> "As the Lord<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> before<WH6440> whom<WH834> I stand,<WH5975> I will take<WH3947> nothing.<WH518>" And he urged<WH6484> him to take<WH3947> [it,] but he refused.<WH3985>

And Naaman<WH5283> said,<WH559> "If not, please<WH4994> let your servant<WH5650> at least be given<WH5414> two<WH6776> mules' load<WH4853> of earth;<WH127> for your servant<WH5650> will no<WH3808> more<WH5750> offer<WH6213> burnt<WH5930> offering<WH5930> nor<WH3808> will he sacrifice<WH2077> to other<WH312> gods,<WH430> but to the Lord.<WH3068>

"In this<WH2088> matter<WH1697> may the Lord<WH3068> pardon<WH5545> your servant:<WH5650> when my master<WH113> goes<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of Rimmon<WH7417> to worship<WH7812> there,<WH8033> and he leans<WH8172> on my hand<WH3027> and I bow<WH7812> myself in the house<WH1004> of Rimmon,<WH7417> when I bow<WH7812> myself in the house<WH1004> of Rimmon,<WH7417> the Lord<WH3068> pardon<WH5545> your servant<WH5650> in this<WH2088> matter.<WH1697>"
And he said<WH559> to him, "Go<WH1980> in peace.<WH7965>" So he departed<WH1980> from him some<WH3530> distance.<WH3530> <WH776>

But Gehazi,<WH1522> the servant<WH5288> of Elisha<WH477> the man<WH376> of God,<WH430> thought,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> my master<WH113> has spared<WH2820> this<WH2088> Naaman<WH5283> the Aramean,<WH761> by not receiving<WH3947> from his hands<WH3027> what<WH834> he brought.<WH935> As the Lord<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> I will run<WH7323> after<WH310> him and take<WH3947> something<WH3972> from him."

So Gehazi<WH1522> pursued<WH7291> Naaman.<WH5283> When Naaman<WH5283> saw<WH7200> one running<WH7323> after<WH310> him, he came<WH5307> down<WH5307> from the chariot<WH4818> to meet<WH7122> him and said,<WH559> "Is all well<WH7965>?"

And he said,<WH559> "All is well.<WH7965> My master<WH113> has sent<WH7971> me, saying,<WH559> 'Behold,<WH2009> just<WH2088> now<WH6258> two<WH8147> young<WH5288> men<WH5288> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> have come<WH935> to me from the hill<WH2022> country<WH2022> of Ephraim.<WH669> Please<WH4994> give<WH5414> them a talent<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> and two<WH8147> changes<WH2487> of clothes.<WH899>'"

And Naaman<WH5283> said,<WH559> "Be pleased<WH2974> to take<WH3947> two talents.<WH3603>" And he urged<WH6555> him, and bound<WH6696> two talents<WH3603> of silver<WH3701> in two<WH8147> bags<WH2754> with two<WH8147> changes<WH2487> of clothes,<WH899> and gave<WH5414> them to two<WH8147> of his servants;<WH5288> and they carried<WH5375> [them] before<WH6440> him.

When he came<WH935> to the hill,<WH6076> he took<WH3947> them from their hand<WH3027> and deposited<WH6485> them in the house,<WH1004> and he sent<WH7971> the men<WH376> away,<WH7971> and they departed.<WH1980>

But he went<WH935> in and stood<WH5975> before<WH413> his master.<WH113> And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559> to him, "Where<WH575> have you been, Gehazi<WH1522>?" And he said,<WH559> "Your servant<WH5650> went<WH1980> nowhere.<WH3808> <WH575>"

Then he said<WH559> to him, "Did not my heart<WH3820> go<WH1980> [with you,] when<WH9201> the man<WH376> turned<WH2015> from his chariot<WH4818> to meet<WH7122> you? Is it a time<WH6256> to receive<WH3947> money<WH3701> and to receive<WH3947> clothes<WH899> and olive<WH2132> groves<WH2132> and vineyards<WH3754> and sheep<WH6629> and oxen<WH1241> and male<WH5650> and female<WH8198> servants<WH5650> <WH8198>?

"Therefore, the leprosy<WH6883> of Naaman<WH5283> shall cleave<WH1692> to you and to your descendants<WH2233> forever.<WH5769>" So he went<WH3318> out from his presence<WH6440> a leper<WH6879> [as white] as snow.<WH7950>
